sect1.title: Migrating from Previous Versions
sect1.para: This chapter documents primarily backwards compatibility breaks made in Zend_Navigation and Zend_View_Helper_Navigation, and should serve to aid in migration from previous versions.

sect2.title: Migrating from versions prior to 1.9
sect2.para: Prior to the 1.9 release, the menu helper (Zend_View_Helper_Navigation_Menu) did not render sub menus correctly. When the onlyActiveBranch was TRUE and the option renderParents FALSE, nothing would be rendered if the deepest active page was at a depth lower than the minDepth option.
In simpler words; if minDepth was set to 1 and the active page was at one of the first level pages, nothing would be rendered, as the following example shows.
sect2.programlisting:
<?php
$container = new Zend_Navigation(array(
    array(
        'label' => 'Home',
        'uri'   => '#'
    ),
    array(
        'label'  => 'Products',
        'uri'    => '#',
        'active' => true,
        'pages'  => array(
            array(
                'label' => 'Server',
                'uri'   => '#'
            ),
            array(
                'label' => 'Studio',
                'uri'   => '#'
            )
        )
    ),
    array(
        'label' => 'Solutions',
        'uri'   => '#'
    )
));
